item.description:
From publisher blurb:

Halloween is more than just another holiday. It’s a time of year in which ghouls and goblins roam freely amongst the newly fallen leaves of brown and orange. It’s a time of year in which many people seek thrills and chills by going to “spook houses” or by watching an insane amount of horror flcks. But during the 1980s, it was also a time in which the networks showcased numerous animated Halloween Specials that kids of all ages could (and did) look forward to. In most cases, such specials were derived from a popular series of the time.

Along similar lines, it wasn’t unheard of for a series to have horror elements year-round rather than just a one-off special in October. Granted, the brand of horror demonstrated by these series was a far cry from that of the horror fims.

This document seeks to bring horror to your games of Cartoon Action Hour, whether you want to run a Halloween Special for your existing series or create a new series laden with horror trappings.

The fist section of the document deals evoking the appropriate style of horror into the game, offering hints, tips and advice. The second section presents a new horror-themed series, Creature Busters.
